sentences.text: The success of new product intro ductions depends on a number of factors including, but not limited to, timely and successful product development, market acceptance, the Company ’s ability to manage the risks associated with new product production rampup issues, the availability of application software for new produc ts, the effective management of purchase commitment s and inventory levels in line with anticipated product demand, the availability of pro ducts in appropriate quantities and costs to meet a nticipated demand, and the risk that new products may have quality or other defects in the e arly stages of introduction..

sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company also reviews its long-lived assets, including capital assets held at its suppliers’ facilities, for impairment whenever events or circu mstances indicate the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: If the C ompany determines that impairment has occurred, it records a writedown equal to the amount by which the carrying value of the assets ex ceeds its fair market value..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Although the Company b elieves its provisions related to inventory, capital assets, other assets and purchas e commitments are currently adequate, no assurance can be given that the Company will not incur additional related charges given the rapid an d unpredictable pace of product obsolescence in the industries in which the Company competes..

sentences.text: The Company may be subject to information technolog y system failures and network disruptions..

sentences.text: These ma y be caused by natural disasters, accidents, power disruptions, telecommunications fa ilures, acts of terrorism or war, computer viruses, physical or electronic breakins, or similar events or disruptions..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: System redundancy may be ine ffective or inadequate, and the Company’ s disaster recovery planning may not be sufficient for all eventualities..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Such failures or disruptions could prevent access to the Company’ s online stores and services, preclude retail store transactions, compromise Company or customer data, and result in delayed or cancelled orders..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: System f ailures and disruptions could also impede the manufacturing and shipping of products, delivery of online services, transactions processin g and financial reporting..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company may be subject to breaches of its infor mation technology systems, which could damage busin ess partner and customer relationships, curtail or otherwise adversely impac t access to online stores and services, and could s ubject the Company to significant reputational, financial, legal, and operational con sequences..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company’s business requires it to use and store customer, employee, and business partner personall y identifiable information (“PII”)..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: This may include names, addresses, phone numbers, email addresses, contact 16  preferences, tax identification numbers, and paymen t account information..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Although malicious attacks t o gain access to PII affect many companies across various industries, the Company ma y be at a relatively greater risk of being targeted because of its high profile and the amount of PII managed..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company requires user names and passwords in or der to access its information technology systems..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: T he Company also uses encryption and authentication technologies to secure the transmiss ion and storage of data..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: These security measures ma y be compromised as a result of thirdparty security breaches, employee error, malfeasanc e, faulty password management, or other irregularit y, and result in persons obtaining unauthorized access to Company data or accounts..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Th ird parties may attempt to fraudulently induce empl oyees or customers into disclosing user names, passwords or other sensitive information, wh ich may in turn be used to access the Company’ s information technology systems..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: To help protect customers and the Company, the Company moni tors accounts and systems for unusual activity and may freeze accounts under suspicious circumstances, which may result in the delay or los s of customer orders..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company devotes significant resources to networ k security, data encryption, and other security mea sures to protect its systems and data, but these security measures cannot provide absolute sec urity..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company may experience a breach of its s ystems and may be unable to protect sensitive data..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Moreover, if a computer security br each affects the Company’ s systems or results in the unauthorized release of PII, the Company’s reputation and brand could be materially damaged and use of the Company’ s products and services could decrease..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company would also be exposed to a risk of loss or litigati on and possible liability..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company’s business is subject to a variety of U .S..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: and international laws, rules, policies and oth er obligations regarding data protection..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company is subject to federal, state and intern ational laws relating to the collection, use, reten tion, security and transfer of PII..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: In many cases, these laws apply not only to thirdparty transactions, but also to transfers of inform ation between the Company and its subsidiaries, and among the Company, its subsidiaries and other parti es with which the Company has commercial relations..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Several jurisdictions have passed new laws in this area, and other jurisdictions are cons idering imposing additional restrictions..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: These law s continue to develop and may be inconsistent from jurisdiction to jurisdiction..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Com plying with emerging and changing international req uirements may cause the Company to incur substantial costs or require the Company to c hange its business practices..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Noncompliance could r esult in penalties or significant legal liability..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company’ s privacy policy and related practices concerning t he use and disclosure of data are posted on its web site..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Any failure by the Company, its suppliers or other parties with whom t he Company does business to comply with its posted privacy policy or with other federal, state or international privacyrelated or data protection laws and regulations cou ld result in proceedings against the Company by gov ernmental entities or others..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company is also subject to payment card associa tion rules and obligations under its contracts with payment card processors..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Under these rules and obligations, if information is compromise d, the Company could be liable to payment card issu ers for the cost of associated expenses and penalties..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: In addition, if the Company fails to follow payment card industry security standards, e ven if no customer information is compromised, the Company could incur significant fi nes or experience a significant increase in payment card transaction costs..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company expects its quarterly revenue and opera ting results to fluctuate..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company’s profit margins vary among its product s and its distribution channels..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company’ s software, accessories, and service and support contracts generally have higher gross margi ns than certain of the Company’s other products..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: Gr oss margins on the Company’ s hardware products vary across product lines and can change o ver time as a result of product transitions, pricin g and configuration changes, and component, warranty, and other cost fluctuations..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: T he Company’s direct sales generally have higher ass ociated gross margins than its 17  indirect sales through its channel partners..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: In add ition, the Company’ s gross margin and operating margin percentages, as well as overall profitability, may be materially adversely impacted as a result of a shift in product, geographic or c hannel mix, new products, component cost increases, strengthening U.S..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: dollar, or price comp etition..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company has typically experienced high er net sales in the first fiscal quarter compared to other fiscal quarters due in part to ho liday seasonal demand..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: Actual and anticipated timin g of new product introductions by the Company can also significantly impact the level of net sales experienced by the Company in any particu lar quarter..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company could be subject to unexpected developments late in a quarte r, such as lower-than-anticipated demand for the Co mpany’s products, issues with new product introductions, an internal systems failure, or failure of one of the Company’s logistics, comp onents supply, or manufacturing partners..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company’s stock price is subject to volatility..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company’ s stock continues to experience substantial price v olatility..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: Additionally, the Company, the technolog y industry, and the stock market as a whole have experienced extreme stock pr ice and volume fluctuations that have affected stoc k prices in ways that may have been unrelated to these companies’ operating performance..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company believes its sto ck price reflects high future growth and profitabil ity expectations..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: If the Company fails to meet these ex pectations its stock price may significantly declin e, which could have a material adverse impact on investor confidence and employee retentio n..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company’s business is subject to the risks of i nternational operations..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company derives a significant portion of its re venue and earnings from its international operation s..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Compliance with applicable U.S..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: and foreign laws and regulations, such as import and ex port requirements, anticorruption laws, tax laws, foreign exchange control s and cash repatriation restrictions, data privacy requirement s, environmental laws, labor laws, and anticompetition regulations, increases the costs of doi ng business in foreign jurisdictions..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Although the Com pany has implemented policies and procedures to com ply with these laws and regulations, a violation by the Company’s employees, contractors, or agents could nevertheless occur..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company also could be significantly affected by other risks associated with international activiti es including, but not limited to, economic and labor conditions, increased duties, taxes and o ther costs, political instability, and changes in t he value of the U.S..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: dollar versus local currencies..

sentences.text: Margins on sales of the Company’ s products in foreign countries, and on sales of pr oducts that include components obtained from foreign suppliers, could be materially adversely af fected by foreign currency exchange rate fluctuatio ns and by international trade regulations, including duties, tariffs and antidumping penalties ..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company is also exposed to credit and collect ability risk on its trade receivables with customers in certain international markets..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: There c an be no assurance the Company can effectively limi t its credit risk and avoid losses..

sentences.text: For example, the uncertainty re garding the ability of certain European countries t o continue to service their sovereign debt obligations and the related financial restructuring efforts by European governments may cause the valu e of several European currencies, including the euro, to fluctuate, which could adver sely affect the Company’s nonU.S..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.label: positive

sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: dollar, while general ly beneficial to the Company’ s foreign currencydenominated sales and earnings, could cause the Com pany to reduce international pricing and incur loss es on its foreign currency derivative instruments, thereby limiting the benefi t..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Additionally, strengthening of foreign currencie s may also increase the Company’ s cost of product components denominated in those currencies, thus adversely affecting gross margins..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: 18  The Company uses derivative instruments, such as fo reign currency forward and option contracts, to hed ge certain exposures to fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The use of such he dging activities may not offset any or more than a portion of the adverse financial effects of unfavorable movements in foreign exchange rates ove r the limited time the hedges are in place..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company is exposed to credit risk and fluctuati ons in the market values of its investment portfoli o..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company has not recognized any significant loss es on its cash, cash equivalents and marketable sec urities, but could experience significant declines in the market value of its investment port folio..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Given the global nature of its business, the Company has both domestic and international investments..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Credit ratings and pricing of these in vestments can be negatively affected by liquidity, credit deterioration, financial results, economic risk, political risk, sovereign risk or ot her factors..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: As a result, the value and liquidity o f the Company’ s cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities could decline and result in a significant impairment..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company is exposed to credit risk on its trade accounts receivable, vendor non-trade receivables a nd prepayments related to longterm supply agreements, and this risk is heightened duri ng periods when economic conditions worsen..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company distributes its products through thirdparty cellular network carriers, wholesalers, retai lers and valueadded resellers..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: A substantial majority of the Company’s outstanding trade receiva bles are not covered by collateral or credit insura nce..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company’ s exposure to credit and collectability risk on its trade receivables is hig her in certain international markets and its abilit y to mitigate such risks may be limited..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company also has unsecured vendor nontrade receivables resulting from purchases of compo nents by outsourcing partners and other vendors that manufacture subassemblies or assemble final products for the Compa ny..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has made prepayments a ssociated with long-term supply agreements to secure supply of inv entory components..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: As of September 29, 2012, a sign ificant portion of the Company’ s trade receivables were concentrated within cellular netwo rk carriers, and its non-trade receivables and long -term supply agreements were concentrated among a few individual vendors located primarily in Asia..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: While the Company has procedures to monitor and limit exposure to credit risk on its trade and vendor non-trade receivables as well as l ong-term prepayments, there can be no assurance such pr ocedures will effectively limit its credit risk and avoid losses..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company could be impacted by unfavorable result s of legal proceedings..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company is subject to various legal proceedings and claims that have not yet been fully resolved a nd that have arisen in the ordinary course of business, and additional claims may arise in the future..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Results of legal proceedings are subject t o significant uncertainty and, regardless of the merit of the claims, litigation may be expensive, t ime-consuming, disruptive to the Company’ s operations, and distracting to management..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: In recognition of these considerations, the Company ma y enter into arrangements to settle litigation..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: Although management considers the likelihood of suc h an outcome to be remote, if one or more of these legal matters were resolved against the Company in a reporting period for amounts in excess of management’s expectations, the Company’ s consolidated financial statements for that reporting period could be materially adversely affe cted..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: Further, such an outcome could result in sign ificant compensatory, punitive or trebled monetary damages, disgorgement of revenue or profit s, remedial corporate measures or injunctive relief against the Company that could materially adversely affect its financial condition and operating results..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company ’s future effective tax rates could be affected by c hanges in the mix of earnings in countries with differing statutory 19  tax rates, changes in the valuation of deferred tax assets and liabilities, or changes in tax laws or their interpretation..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: The Company is also subject to the examination of its tax returns by the Intern al Revenue Service and other tax authorities..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The C ompany regularly assesses the likelihood of an adverse outcome resulting from these examination s to determine the adequacy of its provision for ta xes..

sentences.text: The Company’ s headquarters are located in Cupertino, California ..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: As of September 29, 2012, the Company owned or le ased approximately 17.3 million square feet of building space, primari ly in the U.S., and to a lesser extent, in Europe, Japan, Canada, and the AsiaPacific regions..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Of that amount approximately 10.9 million square fe et was leased building space, which includes approx imately 4.1 million square feet related to retail store space..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Of the Company’ s owned building space, approximately 2.6 million s quare feet that is located in Cupertino, California will be demolished to build a second corporate campus..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: A dditionally, the Company owns a total of 1,077 acre s of land in various locations..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: As of September 29, 2012, the Company owned a manuf acturing facility in Cork, Ireland that also housed a customer support call center and facilities in Elk Grove, California that included w arehousing and distribution operations and a custom er support call center..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company also owned land in Austin, Texas where it will build off ice space and a customer support call center..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: In ad dition, the Company owned facilities for research and development and corporate functions in Cupertino, California, including land for the futu re development of the Company’ s second corporate campus..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company also owned data cente rs in Newark, California; Maiden, North Carolina; a nd Prineville, Oregon..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Outside the U.S., the Company owned additional facilities for v arious purposes..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: The Company believes its existing facilities and eq uipment, which are used by all operating segments, are in good operating condition and are suitable for the conduct of its business..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: The Compa ny has invested in internal capacity and strategic relationships with outside manufacturing vendors and continues to make investments in capita l equipment as needed to meet anticipated demand fo r its products..
sentences.label: negative

sentences.text: The Company is subject to the various legal proceed ings and claims, including those discussed below as well as certain other legal proceedings and claims that have not been fully resolved and th at have arisen in the ordinary course of business..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: In the opinion of management, there was not at least a reasonable possibility the Company may h ave incurred a material loss, or a material loss in excess of a recorded accrual, with respect to loss contingencies..
sentences.label: neutral

sentences.text: However, the outcome of legal p roceedings and claims brought against the Company i s subject to significant uncertainty..
sentences.label: positive

sentences.text: Therefore, although management considers the likeli hood of such an outcome to be remote, if one or mor e of these legal matters were resolved against the Company in a reporting period for amoun ts in excess of management’s expectations, the Comp any’s consolidated financial statements for that reporting period could be mater ially adversely affected..
